posts.body:
>>a34f624b-5f13-47c6-9a02-0d9cd0eb97df
This as well as the VerifyError errors might be caused by the hack that had to be done to allow the initial self-signed content after switching to ZeroID. It was a solution that was figured out by reading ZeroNet's documentation, so it's possible it has never been done before on other zites (or it has been done on very few). The errors are probably harmless, and if they're indeed caused by this hack there's no other known way to solve this issue without changing ZeroNet itself or just making the old threads and posts invisible again.
>our /tech/ guy is a useless tranny probably 
There's no "/tech/ guy". And even if there was, ZeroNet is a whole different ballgame than regular websites. There's just one guy on the board who seems to be familiar with ZeroNet and Millchan from before 8chan shut down. Everybody else is still figuring out what's pretty much an experimental technology.
>But overall, zeronet does not seem to be very well written.
Maybe, but it's still the only alternative there is for what it does. IPFS is supposed to do the same things, but it's an even immature project.
NNTP (and consequently nntpchan) is also interesting as a more lightweight and simpler alternative for decentralized message boards, so you might want to look into that.

>>1ea74f1b-098e-49b0-ab34-05dd2003aec3
Reminds me of the roastie pasta guy.
Reminder you can use tubeup to easily backup youtube videos to archive.org.

>>297ff555-d3bd-4ce4-875a-ba8eda8fe01c
Well, to be fair, he didn't link to the study, so it takes some research to know even what is he even talking about.
**Not that I'm surprised, since few of the boomers who voted for him would have the ability to read a scientific paper.**
Good. Everybody who steps out of line should be prosecuted and sentenced to jail for a minimum of 20 years. **Civil war when?**

>>c7efbd2c-9a13-4386-b72d-73436fbefd25
Add sage support to the list.

>>5d9a61ab-c92d-47c4-ad0b-e265df2b4a0d

>Define immortality?
Somebody or something that lives forever.

>When you can control the hearts of the people, have the knowledge of how to direct control of power (From economics to agriculture), and have the will to achieve an "impossible" dream, how can you not be "all powerful"?
There are some things no human who is alive today will achieve in his lifetime, regardless of his will. For example, traveling to another galaxy. So no, even if you control everybody you won't be "all powerful". It doesn't matter how much will you have, if a dream is impossible you won't achieve it.

>The devil speaks the truth, too.
Prove it.

>Why do you think that only "good people" tell the truth?
But I don't think that.
